content:
I published the blog post I mentioned in this other channel https://categorytheory.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/229199-learning.3A-questions/topic/Rigorous.20string.20diagrams/near/207180495
but moved this comment over here because in the blog post, I claimed that ACT is in fact a cooperative economic network, so I thought I'd ask what people thought about that.

I don't see much evidence of rivalry and competition, altho I am sure it exists. I see in your statements of values and conduct and general practices not so much an adversarial game (altho I do understand why y'all like them theoretically) but a lot of cooperation.

And the economic elements arrive in the positions topic and the constant discussions of PHD programs and also the applications in economics, industry, and government.

Here's that blog post: https://write.as/economic-networks/visual-languages-resource-flow-diagrams

It's still editable by me, so if anybody wants anything changed, I'm on it...
